intro: Stilago lanceolaria, commonly known as the common sea holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the coastal regions of the Mediterranean and the Atlantic coasts of Europe. The plant is characterized by its spiny, leaf-like bracts that surround its small, yellow flowers. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in maritime environments. Stilago lanceolaria is adapted to salt spray and can tolerate moderate levels of coastal exposure.
